Subject: How  to implement a semi globlal mechanism ?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=321782503; y=csohY3CezCZnjKllr5pDyQc0Rw4h5tL__BH1XDQGnb0QLwjQSLdHeljH

Hey!

I 'm a new user of Cantera and I would like to compare global kinetic=
 
mechanisms for a ch4/o2 flames.
In this way, I would like to know if it i=
s possible to implement in 
CANTERA a semi globlal mechanism define as folo=
w:

Reaction 1:  CH4+(3/2) O2=3D>CO+2 H2O		 A1  E1   n1   n2
Reaction 2:  C=
O+(1/2)O2<=3D>CO2                    A2   E2  n3   n4  n5
			

A : the pree=
xponential factor
E : the activation energy
n : rate exponents

The mechani=
sm set the reaction rates as follow :
q1=3DA1 * ([CH4]^n1*[O2]^n2) * exp(-E=
1/RT)
q2=3DA2 * ([CO]^n3*[O2]^n4-*[CO2]^n5)  * exp(-E2/RT)

(with [X] a mol=
ar concentration.)

To use this mechanism I think that I cannot make a mixt=
ure with 
the "ck2cti" program because I need to take into account the expo=
nent 
constants n1,n2 ,n3, n4 and n5.  

I would like to know if someone ha=
ve an idea of the way to implement 
a kinetic mechanism like that ? 

D.Col=
ombet
CFD Engineer
